text: Simon El'evich Shnol (; 21 March 1930 – 11 September 2021) was a Russian biophysicist, and a historian of science. He was a professor at Moscow State University. He was a member of Russian Academy of Natural Sciences from 1990 until his death. Most of his works were about the oscillatory processes in biology, the theory of evolution, chronobiology, and the history of science. Shnoll died in Moscow on 11 September 2021 at the age of 91.Умер известный ученый и популяризатор науки Симон Шноль ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Russian physicists Category:Russian historians Category:Moscow State University faculty Category:Soviet writers
title: Simon Shnoll
